results.title: At Patantja clay pan
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “People of the Australian western desert (A)”.
Daily activities of two families camped near a clay pan holding water, showing desert food resources in a good season. The men hunt emus and the women collect mulga seed, ngaru fruit and grubs.

results.title: At long last
results.creator_credit: John Ralph, Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A guided tour through the interior and behind the scenes of the new National Library of Canada in Ottawa showing modern devices for information storage and retrieval - teletype, computers, microfilm and an exhaustive card catalogue.

results.title: Assistance India : people to people
results.brief_description: This film shows the organization of Community Aid Abroad and the work it does in under-developed countries, particularly India. Enlightened agricultural and irrigation production; a co-operative rural bank has relieved some financial pressures; and education programmes have given hope for the future. Shows the growth of a self supporting leper community. However despite development, traditional Indian cultural pursuits are strongly perpetuated. No other credits available.

results.title: Assault on human dignity
results.brief_description: An IFAG report by Kurt Bethge which investigates to political maneuvering in the Soviet occupied zone of Germany which led to the erection of the Berlin Wall, and how this affected the people in West Berlin, when world attention was focussed on those in East Berlin.

results.title: Aspirations
results.creator_credit: James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Crossroads of the world: a study of North Africa and the Middle East”.
Education, political reform, and technology are all being used to serve the aims of the society of North Africa and the Middle East. The primary aim is liberation from colonial control and from the grip of poverty. Throughout the region this film finds much new development, aimed for the most part at the production of larger, more varied crops and the organization of new industry. Within sight of the waterwheels of antiquity can be seen the rise of vast power dams and pumping stations, and beyond mud villages steel and concrete cities, schools and factories can be seed.

results.title: Aspects of behaviour (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bruce Hart and Communication Research Media Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Psychology Today”.
Relating psychology to the student’s life experience this film considers ethical issues such as obedience and authority along with prejudice and attitude change. It also examines questions like: what does a social psychologist do? How does physiology relate to behaviour? Do psychologists often agree? What is cultural psychology?

results.title: Ask an Australian about the outdoors [Turkish version]
results.creator_credit: Kay Roberts and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: A family setting out on a picnic prepare by taking adequate food, water and first aid equipment. The danger of fire in the bush is emphasised, and the film also stresses the need to protect the fauna. Note: In Turkish.
